alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:56PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Knox, southern Jefferson and northern Sevier Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of New Market to 8 miles northwest of Sevierville to near Knoxville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Dandridge, Pigeon Forge, Strawberry Plains, Bird Crossing, Fairgarden, Kimberlin Heights, McMahan and Chestnut Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for east Tennessee. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
